condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Education authorities in targeted areas have increased capacity to implement national norms and requirements for water, sanitation and hygiene in kindergartens, schools and dormitories.

description.narrative: In 2019, a new national standard on ‘School Environment Safety' was developed and approved, which includes WASH facility safety components. Through the UNICEF support, national and sub-national institutional capacities (MoECSS and provincial departments of education) enhanced by strengthening WASH in Schools partnership networking and coordination, involving NGOs (World Vision, WASH Action, etc.) and private sector (e.g. MobiCom corporation). Network meetings for sharing the experiences regularly organized under the leadership of the MoECSS. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of Early Childhood Development centers that have water, sanitation and hygience facilities separated for female and male meeting national/JMP standards in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
Number of schools with water and sanitation facilities separated for girls and boys that meet national standards and are have been installed in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
